page.title: 01Wheeldale Plantation Area
page.content: the block s a flattish bleak open aea of heather moorland. It is bisected by the stream. Wheeldale Gill, which forms a fairly steep sided valley below the general level of moorland The valley has remnants of the deciduous woodland along the bottom ad side streams. To the north of the stream is a large area of conifer plantation. Sheep graze parts of the moorland and valley but there are no fenced enclosures. Grouse shooting takes place on the moors. Public access is very limited and there are no rights of way to this relatively remote area except long small public road. However this road is quite popular with drivers and day trippers and the block can be reached on foot from the Goathland area so tourists do come to enjoy the scenery.
